question.text: Which of the following statements regarding fertilization and implantation is incorrect?

options.text: Fertilization can occur only if sperm and ovum simultaneously reach the ampulla of the fallopian tube.
During fertilization, the sperm comes in contact with the corona radiata cells of the ovum first and start degrading it.
The division of the morula leads to the formation of blastocyst.
The embryo is formed by the differentiation of inner cell mass.

solution.text: During fertilisation, the sperm first comes in contact with the 'zona pellucida' layer of the ovum. Certain enzymes are released by the acrosome of the sperm. These enzymes cause certain changes in the zona pellucida layer. Thus, the entry of further sperms is prevented.
